001package edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock;
002
003import edu.pdx.cs410J.ParserException;
004import edu.pdx.cs410J.web.HttpRequestHelper;
005
006import java.io.IOException;
007import java.io.StringReader;
008import java.util.Map;
009
010import static java.net.HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK;
011
012/**
013 * A helper class for accessing the rest client.  Note that this class provides
014 * an example of how to make gets and posts to a URL.  You'll need to change it
015 * to do something other than just send dictionary entries.
016 */
017public class AirlineRestClient extends HttpRequestHelper
018{
019    private static final String WEB_APP = "airline";
020    private static final String SERVLET = "flights";
021
022    private final String url;
023
024
025    /**
026     * Creates a client to the airline REST service running on the given host and port
027     * @param hostName The name of the host
028     * @param port The port
029     */
030    public AirlineRestClient( String hostName, int port )
031    {
032        this.url = String.format( "http://%s:%d/%s/%s", hostName, port, WEB_APP, SERVLET );
033    }
034
035  /**
036   * Returns all dictionary entries from the server
037   */
038  public Map<String, String> getAllDictionaryEntries() throws IOException, ParserException {
039    throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Delete me!");
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Returns the definition for the given airline
044   * @return
045   */
046  public Airline getAirline(String airlineName) throws IOException, ParserException {
047    Response response = get(this.url, Map.of("airline", airlineName));
048    throwExceptionIfNotOkayHttpStatus(response);
049    String content = response.getContent();
050
051    TextParser parser = new TextParser(new StringReader(content));
052    return parser.parse();
053  }
054
055  public void addFlight(String airlineName, Flight flight) throws IOException {
056    Response response = post(this.url, Map.of("airline", airlineName, "flightNumber", String.valueOf(flight.getNumber())));
057    throwExceptionIfNotOkayHttpStatus(response);
058  }
059
060  public void removeAllAirlines() throws IOException {
061    Response response = delete(this.url, Map.of());
062    throwExceptionIfNotOkayHttpStatus(response);
063  }
064
065  private void throwExceptionIfNotOkayHttpStatus(Response response) {
066    int code = response.getCode();
067    if (code != HTTP_OK) {
068      String message = response.getContent();
069      throw new RestException(code, message);
070    }
071  }
072
073}
